page.title: 08Housing South of Oakley 2
page.content: In Oakley there is also an area of {Council housing}some of which have been purchased under recent Government legislation. There are 124 Council Houses along{St.John's Piece,}which were built originally for agricultural workers in 1951 and{Water Ridges}built 1956/7. In the late 1960's, 8 houses & 5 bungalows were built in{Sunnymead and 9 bungalows and 6 houses were built in{Goddard's Firs.}The bungalows are homes for people over the retirement age of 65. There is another area of homes where very old people are looked after by a resident warden, in{Petersfield. Kings Orchard}was developed in 1960's by a group of craftsmen who combined to build them- selves homes. These are detached four bedroomed houses which have changed hands frequently and now sell for about Â£75,000.
